Cuerpo: MIME-Version: 1.0 Server: CERN/3.0 Date: Sunday, 24-Nov-96 21:31:49 GMT Content-Type: text/html Content-Length: 8994 Last-Modified: Friday, 05-Apr-96 11:18:22 GMT Guide to Multimedia Educational Materials Multimedia Educational Materials During the ACM SIGMM business meeting of the 1995 ACM Multimedia conference , interest was expressed in developing a standard syllabus for multimedia education. It contains pointers to on-line information that is useful to those of us developing courses in multimedia. Add a new URL Suggestion Box Books and Journals A Technical Introduction to Digital Video by Charles A. Poynton, published by John Wiley & Sons, 1996 IEEE Multimedia Homepage Multimedia: Computing, Communications and Applications", by Ralf Steinmetz, Klara Nahrstedt, published by Prentice Hall, July 1996 Covers multimedia concepts and implementations, including data representation, compression, storage, communication, operating systems, documents, hypertext and MHEG, user interfaces, synchronization and applications. Complete information about Kluwer's journal, including Aims/Scope information, ordering information, table of contents information, and instructions for authors who may wish to submit papers to the journal. Multimedia Database Systems: Design and Implementation Strategies , edited by Kingsley C. Nwosu A compendium of state-of-the-art research and development work pertaining to the problems and issues in the design and development of multimedia database systems. Distributed Multimedia , by Palmer W. Agnew and Anne S. Kellerman How is the convergence of global communications systems building, who are the major players in it, and how will your own future as an information user or provider be affected? Multimedia Systems , by John F. Koegel Buford This book provides a technical introduction to key issues in multimedia, including detailed discussion of new technologies, principles, current research, and future directions. The book covers important interdisciplinary aspects of digital multimedia systems, among them sound and video recording, television engineering, digital signal processing, systems architectures, user interface, and algorithms. Course Notes Cornell University: Multimedia Systems - A graduate level survey course in multimedia, covering representation, compression, storage, transmission, and processing. It includes the syllabus, reading list and assignments. UC Berkeley: Multimedia Systems and Applications - A graduate level course covering the design and implementation of interactive multimedia applications including interactive television, hypermedia systems, and video conferencing and groupware. Univ of Texas, Austin: Multimedia Communication and Databases - An advanced course in multimedia systems covering transport protocol design, routing and multicasting, mobile networking, operating system support, and multimedia databases. UIUC: Topics in Multimedia Communication - The course covers specific issues of networking and communication related to multimedia. UIUC: Multimedia Computing Systems - Presents integration issues in the design of a multimedia system from specification to software implementation. The course is an introductory course to multimedia computing including compression, OS, communication, synchronization and user interface topics. U. Mass: Multimedia Networking - A graduate-level seminar course in multimedia networking. Include syllabus, reading list, and homeworks. Other Electric Eye Multimediator Canadian multimedia consulting company eb site. Lots of links and information about commercial multimedia applications.
